chapter.title: WDB Call Interface - System Test Specification

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: This document describes the specific tests to be carried out during the system test of the WDB Call Interface. The WCI is the application programmer's interface (API) to the WDB and should be used for all data retrieval by non-WDB applications.

sect2.title: Purpose
sect2.para: The purpose of this document is to describe the test suite for the WDB Call Interface. Specifically, the test specification should:

listitem.para: Clarify the functionality/performance/accesibility requirements of the system
Clearly specify what tests must be passed for the product to be accepted for production
Document the consensus for the level of testing of the WDB Call Interface

sect2.para: For each test, it must be defined what entity has the responsibility for performing the test. Any limitations with respect to the test must also be specified (e.g., for example whether the test has been implemented).
The test specification follows the framework laid out by the WDB Test Plan.

sect1.title: Compilation Test
sect1.para: As a general rule, there should be no new warnings or errors during the compilation or linking of the WDB Call Interface libraries.
Only the warnings documented below are accepted:

table.title: Known Warnings of the WCI Compilation Test

sect1.title: Unit Tests
sect1.para: All core and type C and/or C++ functionality in the WCI should have unit tests.

sect1.title: Install Tests
sect1.para: The functional tests examine that the functionality of the system fulfills the system requirements of the system as defined in Bugzilla. The functionality of the WDB Call Interface is tested using the Category-Partition test design pattern.

sect2.title: Test Cases
sect2.para: The following section describes the test samples that are intended to be handled by the test cases of the test suite.

table.title: WDB Call Interface Installation Test Cases

Call does not permit setting of user to a built-in wdb role even if you have permission on that role (built in roles are not login roles)

Call does not permit SQL code to be executed on database

sect2.title: Performance Tests
sect2.para: The performance tests are performed in the WDB test environment, defined in [1].
